perturbation.original_text: Each of the Participants will contribute to the capital of the Joint Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value. All Participants will contribute their respective Contributions as agreed.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Participants may contribute to the capital of the Joint Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, subject to the sole discretion of each participant. All Participants will contribute their respective Contributions as agreed.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates contributions, the changed text makes them optional and at the discretion of the participant, creating contradiction and ambiguity regarding the commitment to contribute capital.

perturbation.original_text: Decisions regarding the distribution of profits, allocation of losses, and the requirement for Additional Capital Contributions as well as all other financial matters will be decided by a unanimous vote of the Participants.
perturbation.changed_text: Decisions regarding the distribution of profits and the requirement for Additional Capital Contributions will be decided by a majority vote of the Participants. Allocation of losses and all other financial matters will require unanimous consent.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces contradiction by specifying that distribution of profit and additional capital contributions only need majority votes but allocation of losses requires unanimity, whereas the original text demands unanimity for all.

perturbation.original_text:
Any Participant will have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the Joint Venture at any time. Written notice of intention to withdraw must be served in writing upon the remaining Participants at least Thirty (30) business days prior to the withdrawal date.

The voluntary withdrawal of a Participant will  result in the dissolution of the Joint Venture.
perturbation.changed_text:
Any Participant will have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the Joint Venture at any time, provided that such withdrawal does not unduly disrupt the ongoing operations of the Joint Venture. Written notice of intention to withdraw must be served in writing upon the remaining Participants at least Thirty (30) business days prior to the withdrawal date.

The voluntary withdrawal of a Participant may result in the dissolution of the Joint Venture, subject to a vote by the remaining participants.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states that voluntary withdrawal will result in dissolution; the modified version introduces ambiguity by stating that withdrawal may result in dissolution subject to a vote. This creates uncertainty about the consequences of withdrawal.
